definition: birds and animals/the beasts of the field and the birds of the air
generic term for birds and animals/birds/to capture (old)
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)

sentences.english: Its movements imitated the motion of five kinds of birds and beasts.
sentences.chinese: 其招式就模仿了五种飞禽走兽的动作。

sentences.english: Our wisdom can only control the animals but not humans.
sentences.chinese: 人们的智慧能控制飞禽走兽，却无法控制自己。
试想飞禽走兽如何降生。

sentences.english: I also see that there are so many birds and beats entirely at your feet, right under your beautiful velvet skirt.
sentences.chinese: 我也知道有很多飞禽走兽拜倒在你的天鹅绒裙下。

sentences.english: All birds and animals are living beings.
sentences.chinese: 一切飞禽走兽都是生物。

definition: insect or insect-like small creature (literary)/base person (used as a curse word)
Ratitae (formerly Cursores) flightless birds such as ostriches
water flea (small crustacean of genus Daphnia)
